Name: 1 Evergreen needleleaf forests
Description: Lands dominated by woody vegetation with a percent cover >60% and height exceeding 2 meters. Almost all trees remain green all year. Canopy is never without green foliage.

Name: 2 Evergreen broadleaf forests
Description: Lands dominated by woody vegetation with a percent cover >60% and height exceeding 2 meters. Almost all trees and shrubs remain green year round. Canopy is never without green foliage.

Name: 3 Deciduous needleleaf forests
Description: Lands dominated by woody vegetation with a percent cover >60% and height exceeding 2 meters. Consists of seasonal needleleaf tree communities with an annual cycle of leaf-on and leaf-off periods.

Name: 4 Deciduous broadleaf forests
Description: Lands dominated by woody vegetation with a percent cover >60% and height exceeding 2 meters. Consists of broadleaf tree communities with an annual cycle of leaf-on and leaf-off periods.

Name: 5 Mixed forests
Description: Lands dominated by trees with a percent cover >60% and height exceeding 2 meters. Consists of tree communities with interspersed mixtures or mosaics of the other four forest types. None of the forest types exceeds 60% of landscape.

Name: 6 Closed shrublands
Description: Lands with woody vegetation less than 2 meters tall and with shrub canopy cover >60%. The shrub foliage can be either evergreen or deciduous.

Name: 7 Open shrublands
Description: Lands with woody vegetation less than 2 meters tall and with shrub canopy cover between 10-60%. The shrub foliage can be either evergreen or deciduous.

Name: 8 Woody savannas
Description: Lands with herbaceous and other understory systems, and with forest canopy cover between 30-60%. The forest cover height exceeds 2 meters.

Name: 9 Savannas
Description: Lands with herbaceous and other understory systems, and with forest canopy cover between 10-30%. The forest cover height exceeds 2 meters.

Name: 10 Grasslands
Description: Lands with herbaceous types of cover. Tree and shrub cover is less than 10%. Permanent wetlands lands with a permanent mixture of water and herbaceous or woody vegetation. The vegetation can be present in either salt, brackish, or fresh water.

Name: 11 Permanent wetlands
Description: Lands with a permanent mixture of water and herbaceous or woody vegetation that cover extensive areas. The vegetation can be present in either salt, brackish, or fresh water.

Name: 12 Croplands
Description: Lands covered with temporary crops followed by harvest and a bare soil period (e.g., single and multiple cropping systems). Note that perennial woody crops will be classified as the appropriate forest or shrub land cover type.

Name: 13 Urban and built-up lands
Description: Land covered by buildings and other man-made structures.

Name: 14 Cropland/natural vegetation mosaics
Description: Lands with a mosaic of croplands, forest, shrublands, and grasslands in which no one component comprises more than 60% of the landscape.

Name: 15 Snow and ice
Description: Lands under snow/ice cover most of the year.

Name: 16 Barren
Description: Lands exposed soil, sand, or rocks and has less than 10% vegetative cover during any time of the year.
